name: Train (revuetext)
description:
This is a small, practically never-ending prototype made as practice for procedural generation, based on the numerous trips I've taken on the Tokyo train system. There's no music in-game, but feel free to throw on whatever tunes you enjoy, and if anyone has any suggestions for non-copyrighted music, feel free to tell me (it gets a little dull with just the ambient hum.)

Controls are stated at the beginning, but just in case, they are: WASD to move, E to sit down when in the vicinity of certain seats (the radius is sort of small, you might have to walk up against the seats and move around a bit to find a proper one), and Escape to quit.

Made with the 'I make games but I'm broke starter pack' a combination of SketchUp, Blender, and - of course - Unity. All assets and scripts aside from some default Unity scripts are made by myself.
